title: Hymnus tabaci a poem in honour of tabaco. Heroïcally composed by Raphael Thorius: made English by Peter Hausted Mr of Arts Camb.
author: Thorius, Raphael, d. 1625.
publisher: Printed by T.N. for Humphrey Moseley, and are to be sold at his shop at the sign of the Princes Arms in St Pauls Churchyard,
notes: Editor's preface signed: Lud. à Kinschot.
"Cheimonopegnion" has separate dated title page and pagination; register is continuous = Thomason E.1369[2].
Annotation on Thomason copy: "Jan: 27 1650"; imprint date crossed through.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
